data.enText: break
to break sth, or to be broken, violently and noisily into many pieces

data.chText: 几扇窗户劈里啪啦打碎了。
data.enText: Several windows had been smashed.

data.chText: 他啪的一声把收音机摔得稀巴烂。
data.enText: He smashed the radio to pieces.

data.chText: 玻璃碗咣的一声摔了个粉碎。
data.enText: The glass bowl smashed into a thousand pieces.
hit very hard
to move with a lot of force against sth solid; to make sth do this

data.chText: 浪涛猛烈撞击礁石的声音
data.enText: the sound of waves smashing against the rocks
The car smashed into a tree.

data.chText: 马克狠狠地把拳头砸在桌上。
data.enText: Mark smashed his fist down on the desk.
to hit sth very hard and break it, in order to get through it

data.chText: 他们只好奋力在冰上凿洞。
data.enText: They had to smash holes in the ice.

data.chText: 大象横冲直撞，闯过树丛。
data.enText: The elephant smashed its way through the trees.

data.chText: 我们只得用力把门撞开。
data.enText: We had to smash the door open.

data.chText: 他们砸破一道玻璃门进去了。
data.enText: They had smashed through a glass door to get in.
to hit sth/sb very hard
He smashed the ball into the goal.
destroy/defeat
to destroy, defeat or put an end to sth/sb

data.chText: 警方说他们摧毁了一个大贩毒集团。
data.enText: Police say they have smashed a major drugs ring.
She has smashed the world record (= broken it by a large amount) .
crash vehicle
to crash a vehicle

data.chText: 他把自己的新车撞毁了。
data.enText: He's smashed (up) his new car.
in tennis, etc.
to hit a high ball downwards and very hard over the net
smash sth↔down
to make sth fall down by hitting it hard and breaking it
The police had to smash the door down.
smash sth↔in
to make a hole in sth by hitting it with a lot of force
Vandals had smashed the door in.

data.chText: 当时我真想把他的脸打瘪。
data.enText: I wanted to smash his face in (= hit him hard in the face) .
smash sth↔up
to destroy sth deliberately

data.chText: 一群年轻人闯进酒吧，把里面砸了个乱七八糟。
data.enText: Youths had broken into the bar and smashed the place up.
act of breaking

data.chText: 破碎；打碎；破碎（或打碎）的哗啦声
data.enText: an act of breaking sth noisily into pieces; the sound this makes

data.chText: 杯子掉到地上哗啦一声摔碎了。
data.enText: The cup hit the floor with a smash.
vehicle crash
an accident in which a vehicle hits another vehicle
a car smash
in tennis, etc.
a way of hitting the ball downwards and very hard
song/movie/play
smash hit

data.chText: 十分走红的歌曲（或电影、戏剧）
data.enText: a song, film/movie or play that is very popular

data.chText: 她的最新一首十分走红的上榜歌曲
data.enText: her latest chart smash

data.chText: 以上各词均含碰撞、撞击之义，尤指撞车。
data.enText: These are all words that can be used when sth, especially a vehicle, hits sth else very hard and is damaged or destroyed.
crash

data.chText: 指（使）物体或交通工具碰撞或撞击：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to hit an object or another vehicle, causing damage; to make a vehicle do this

data.chText: 飞机会失事把我吓坏了。
data.enText: I was terrified that the plane would crash.
slam (sth) into/against sb/sth
to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this

data.chText: 汽车打滑，重重地撞到树上。
data.enText: The car skidded and slammed into a tree.
collide

data.chText: 指交通工具或人碰撞、相撞或撞上：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) (of two vehicles or people) to crash into each other; (of a vehicle or person) to crash into sb/sth else

data.chText: 那辆小轿车和货车在浓雾中迎面相撞。
data.enText: The car and the van collided head-on in thick fog.
smash

data.chText: 指（使）猛烈撞击、猛烈碰撞或撞车：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this; to crash a car

data.chText: 飙车抢劫者驾着偷来的汽车撞破商店橱窗。
data.enText: Ramraiders smashed a stolen car through the shop window.

data.chText: crash尤指交通工具碰撞，可不与介词连用：
data.enText: Crash is used particularly for vehicles and can be used without a preposition.
We're going to crash, aren't we?

data.chText: slam和smash表示此义时总是与介词连用：
data.enText: In this meaning slam and smash always take a preposition.
We're going to slam/smash, aren't we?

data.chText: 两词均可用于除交通工具外的范围更广的事物。crash与介词连用也可用于其他事物：
data.enText: They are used for a much wider range of things than just vehicles. Crash can also be used for other things, if used with a preposition.

data.chText: 他砰的一声将电话听筒摔下来。
data.enText: He crashed down the telephone receiver.
crash, slam or smash?
wreck

data.chText: 指使交通工具撞坏或毁坏
data.enText: to crash a vehicle and damage it so badly that it is not worth repairing
The two vehicles crashed/collided.
The two vehicles crashed/slammed/smashed into each other .
The car/plane crashed/slammed/smashed into a tree.
I've crashed/smashed/wrecked the car .
to crash/slam/collide/smash head-on (into/with sth)

means: 十分走红的歌曲（或电影、戏剧）

data.enText: smash sth↔down
to make sth fall down by hitting it hard and breaking it
The police had to smash the door down.
smash sth↔in
to make a hole in sth by hitting it with a lot of force
Vandals had smashed the door in.

data.chText: 当时我真想把他的脸打瘪。
data.enText: I wanted to smash his face in (= hit him hard in the face) .
smash sth↔up
to destroy sth deliberately

data.chText: 一群年轻人闯进酒吧，把里面砸了个乱七八糟。
data.enText: Youths had broken into the bar and smashed the place up.

example: that song was his first hit and marked the beginning of his career
that new Broadway show is a real smasher
the party went with a bang

tr: the act of colliding with something
example: his crash through the window
the fullback's smash into the defensive line

tr: a hard return hitting the tennis ball above your head
a serious collision (especially of motor vehicles)

example: the sudden knock floored him
he took a bash right in his face
he got a bang on the head

tr: break suddenly into pieces, as from a violent blow
example: The window smashed

tr: break into pieces, as by striking or knocking over
example: Smash a plate

tr: overthrow or destroy (something considered evil or harmful)
example: The police smashed the drug ring after they were tipped off
He smashed a 3-run homer

tr: collide or strike violently and suddenly
example: The motorcycle smashed into the guard rail

tr: hit (a tennis ball) in a powerful overhead stroke
damage or destroy as if by violence
example: The teenager banged up the car of his mother
She was crushed by his refusal of her invitation
The death of her son smashed her
She smashed her car against the guard rail
My daughter's fancy wedding is going to break me!
The slump in the financial markets smashed him
the car went smash through the fence

value.def: If you smash something or if it smashes, it breaks into many pieces, for example when it is hit or dropped.

example.ex: A crowd of youths started smashing windows...
example.tran: 一群年轻人开始砸玻璃。

example.ex: Two or three glasses fell off and smashed into pieces.
example.tran: 两三只杯子掉了下来，摔得粉碎。

value.def: If you smash through a wall, gate, or door, you get through it by hitting and breaking it.

example.ex: The demonstrators used trucks to smash through embassy gates...
example.tran: 示威者用卡车撞开了使馆大门。

example.ex: Soldiers smashed their way into his office.
example.tran: 士兵冲进了他的办公室。

value.def: If something smashes or is smashed against something solid, it moves very fast and with great force against it.

example.ex: The bottle smashed against a wall...
He smashed his fist into Anthony's face.
example.tran: 他一拳打在了安东尼脸上。

value.def: To smash a political group or system means to deliberately destroy it.

example.ex: Their attempts to clean up politics and smash the power of party machines failed.
example.tran: 他们力图重整政坛、摧毁现有的政党机器，却以失败收场。

value.tran: (有意识地)摧毁，粉碎，消灭(政治组织、制度等)

value.def: A smash is the same as a smash hit .

example.ex: It is the public who decide if a film is a smash or a flop.
example.tran: 影片成败与否取决于公众。

value.def: You can refer to a car crash as a smash .

example.ex: He was near to death after a car smash.
example.tran: 他差点在一场撞车事故中丧命。
